video.name: INSTANT POT MUSHROOM BOURGUIGNON With Potato Cauliflower Mash | Vegan Richa Recipes
video.description:
Vegan Mushroom Bourguignon served over Potato Cauliflower Mash. Instant Pot or Saucepan.
ðŸ’™ FULL RECIPE: https://www.veganricha.com/2018/10/vegan-mushroom-bourguignon-instant-pot.html
ðŸ’™ MY BOOKS: https://veganricha.com/mybooks

Instant Pot Mushroom Bourguignon with Potato Cauliflower Mash. All Cooked in an Instant Pot together with PIP (pot in pot). This is how one should be introduced to mushrooms(so smooth, so delicious!). 

This Vegan Bourguignon uses mushrooms and veggies, loads of flavor addition, and 1 Pot. I also steam the potato and cauliflower while the mushrooms cook, Pot in Pot Cooking. It saves time and pots. Mash the steamed veggies, add herbs of choice, some non dairy milk for creamyness and serve. You can cook the potatoes/cauliflower separately if you like and also make this on the stove top. See recipe notes for Stovetop instructions and times. Lets get cooking!
Vegan Gluten-free Nut-free Recipe, can be Soy-free Oilfree.

More Holiday Recipes: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Raw27tjni5o&list=PL_i8BdL_yG6s9pQAdLf8SoUx3ZSl7yRYQ

#veganricha #easyveganrecipes #vegan #veganism #veganrecipes #cooking 
Music: Rainy Days by Joakim Karud

recipeIngredient: 10 oz sliced mushrooms (mixed or white or cremini)
1/4 cup brandy or whiskey or red wine or use broth
3/4 tsp dried thyme or 1 tbsp fresh
1 tbsp soy sauce (,tamari for gluten-free, coconut aminos for soyfree)
1 tbsp cornstarch or arrowroot starch mixed in 3 tbsp water ((you can also add 2 tbsp of the mashed potato mixture to thicken))

recipeInstructions.text: Heat the Instant Pot on Saute. Add oil. When the oil is hot, add the onion, garlic, mushrooms and a good pinch of salt and give them a quick mix. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes until golden on some edges. Add a tbsp of water if browning too quickly.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat the Instant Pot on Saute. Add oil. When the oil is hot, add the onion, garlic, mushrooms and a good pinch of salt and give them a quick mix. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes until golden on some edges. Add a tbsp of water if browning too quickly.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the wine and mix well for a few seconds to cook out the alcohol.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the wine and mix well for a few seconds to cook out the alcohol.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the carrots, celery, thyme and garlic and mix well. Add the soy sauce, tomato paste, 1/3 tsp salt (if using water or unsalted broth) and water/broth and give it a mix. Cancel saute. You can also add in 1 bay leaf and some rosemary for flavor variation at this point.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the carrots, celery, thyme and garlic and mix well. Add the soy sauce, tomato paste, 1/3 tsp salt (if using water or unsalted broth) and water/broth and give it a mix. Cancel saute. You can also add in 1 bay leaf and some rosemary for flavor variation at this point.

recipeInstructions.text: Place the steamer basket on top of the mushroom mixture. Add potato and cauliflower to it.
recipeInstructions.name: Place the steamer basket on top of the mushroom mixture. Add potato and cauliflower to it.

recipeInstructions.text: Close the Instant Pot lid. Pressure Cook for 9 to 10 minutes (Manual hi pressure). Add a minute if using larger quantity of either mushroom mix or potatoes, or if doubling.
recipeInstructions.name: Close the Instant Pot lid. Pressure Cook for 9 to 10 minutes (Manual hi pressure). Add a minute if using larger quantity of either mushroom mix or potatoes, or if doubling.

recipeInstructions.text: Let the pressure release naturally once the cooking is complete. Open the lid and carefully remove the steamer basket.
recipeInstructions.name: Let the pressure release naturally once the cooking is complete. Open the lid and carefully remove the steamer basket.

recipeInstructions.text: Put the pot on saute, Add cornstarch slurry and give it a mix (you can also add 2 tbsp of the mashed potato mixture to thicken). Add spinach or baby kale and black pepper and mix. Bring the mixture to a boil to thicken, then cancel saute. Taste and adjust salt and flavor.
recipeInstructions.name: Put the pot on saute, Add cornstarch slurry and give it a mix (you can also add 2 tbsp of the mashed potato mixture to thicken). Add spinach or baby kale and black pepper and mix. Bring the mixture to a boil to thicken, then cancel saute. Taste and adjust salt and flavor.

recipeInstructions.text: Meanwhile. Transfer the steamed potato and cauliflower to a bowl and mash roughly. Add garlic powder, salt, pepper, olive oil, non dairy milk  and optionally fresh/dried herbs of choice(eg. thyme, rosemary, chives) and mash well to preferred consistency.
recipeInstructions.name: Meanwhile. Transfer the steamed potato and cauliflower to a bowl and mash roughly. Add garlic powder, salt, pepper, olive oil, non dairy milk  and optionally fresh/dried herbs of choice(eg. thyme, rosemary, chives) and mash well to preferred consistency.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve the mash layered with the mushroom bourguignon. Garnish with some fresh thyme or basil and black or white pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve the mash layered with the mushroom bourguignon. Garnish with some fresh thyme or basil and black or white pepper.
